title: Tools & Setup
description: Learn the core tools, settings, and preparation steps for consistent practice.
tldr: Match your machine settings to the metal thickness. Prepare clean surfaces and keep your torch angle consistent.

sections.title: Core equipment
sections.body: Understand the welder, clamps, torch, and filler wire. Each part affects stability and bead quality.

sections.title: Surface preparation
sections.body: Remove rust, oil, and paint before welding. Clean metal helps the arc stay steady and reduces defects.

sections.title: Dialing settings
sections.body: Start with recommended settings, then make small adjustments. Keep notes so you can repeat good results.

quiz.question: What should you do before welding painted metal?
quiz.explanation: Clean surfaces improve stability and safety.

quiz.question: Why keep a settings log?
quiz.explanation: Recording settings helps you learn faster.

quiz.question: Which part holds your work steady?
quiz.explanation: Clamps secure the metal and complete the circuit.
